title: What are some books like 'The Way of Kings' by Brandon Sanderson? - Quora

response.answer_text: I agree with Viktor about The Wheel of Time series. I’m thinking of sweeping epic fantasies that have complex plots and several viewpoint characters. I would also suggest that you read Mistborn, which is Sanderson’s other best-known work. It’s a trilogy, followed by another trilogy that takes place in the same world, a few hundred years later. Pat Rothfuss’s Kingkiller Chronicles are awesome. You would love them. He’s only released 2 of the 3 books so far. But these are in first person, so they aren’t as complex with regard to multiple viewpoint characters as the Stormlight Archive is. And of course there’s Game of Thrones, which I personally don’t care for, but they are big, epic, high fantasies. There’s also Terry Goodkind’s Sword of Truth, which comprises 17 books in a loose series. The first book, Wizard’s First Rule, was pretty good, but IMHO, the series sort of devolved from there. You could also check out Melanie Rawn’s Dragon Prince books. They’re a bit slower, but have good characters. Interesting fact—these are the books that got Brandon Sanderson into reading when he was a kid. Specifically, it was the cover art created by Michael Whalen that appealed to him. The Rainwild series and the Liveship Traders series by Robin Hobb are great, but not as heavy on the action and fighting. They’re more character focused. But they take place in a rich world. The Malazan Book of the Fallen Series by Stephen Donaldson is also a monster of a series with 10 books that are each around 250k words and dozens of viewpoint characters. The first few books were good, but after about book 4, I started having a hard time with them. The plot wasn’t quite as cohesive as I like, and didn’t follow the same characters very much. There is also Tad Williams’s Memory, Sorrow, and Thorn series. Classic high fantasy. I haven’t read this series for 20 years, but I loved it when I was 15. I could keep going but that’s enough to give you some good options to consider.

In what way 'like' The Way of Kings?  A grand, epic story with a large scope set in a fully fictional world (also known as 'high fantasy') with a detailed geography, culture, magical system and so forth?  Try "The Wheel of Time" by Robert Jordan, the mother of all epic fantasy (in word count at least), and also co-authored by Brandon Sanderson, the author of TWOK.
